info.name: 4. Duo Admin API [Child]
info.description:
This collection enables you to directly manage a _specific_ Duo child account beneath your Duo MSP parent tenant via the [Duo Admin API](https://duo.com/docs/adminapi). It offers methods to create, retrieve, update, and delete core Duo such as users, phones, hardware tokens, admins, integrations, logs, and more.

#### üöÄ Getting started with this collection

**Step 1**(If necessary)**:** Refer to the Duo Accounts API collection, and ensure performed all of the outlined prerequisites.

**Step 2:** In the **Duo Admin API \[Child\]** collection, go to the variables tab and enter the desired child account's name in the `child_account_name` variable field. This name must match exactly as it appears in the Duo Admin Panel.

\*NOTE:\*To confirm the correct account name, you can use the 'Retrieve Accounts' request in the **Duo Accounts API** collection, which provides a list of child accounts and their names.

**Step 3:** After populating `child_account_name`, navigate to the **Setup Child Account** folder and execute the 'Deploy Admin API' request. This request creates an Admin API integration on the target acount, and populates the request credentials automatically. Additionally, it adds the Duo reqeust credentials (IKEY, SKEY, and API HOSTNAME) to a collection variable called `child_admin_api_matrix`. This will allow you to use the Admin API on the target account in the future.

**\*IMPORTANT NOTE**\*: Before you can use this Admin API application to make API calls to the designated child account, you are required to log into the child account directly and enable all of the grant permissions. See [here](https://duo.com/docs/adminapi#first-steps)

**Step 4**: Be sure to configure any necessary or optional parameters for any particular request within this collection as specified in the Duo Admin API documentation. After setting up the environment variables and configuring parameters as needed, you're ready to utilize any request within the Duo Admin API \[Child\] collection.

#### üí° Collection Note

The collection performs multiple functions.

1. **Deploy Admin API:** This request automates the deployment of the Admin API through a series of steps. Initially, it runs "Retrieve Accounts" to retrieve the list of child accounts and identifies the specific account ID by referencing the `child_account_name` variable. Subsequently, it creates the Admin API on the identified child account via "Create Integration" and obtains the secret key required for authentication via "Retrieve Secret Key." The script stores these values as both collection variables to allow API calls to be made and also adds the API detaials to the `child_admin_api_matrix` for future use. In subsequent requests, it checks for existing entries in the matrix to determine if the Admin API \[Child\] already exists for a particular account and updates the collection variables accordingly.
    
2. **Clear Admin API Variables:** This request serves to clear the values of the collection variables related to the Admin API. It resets the `child_account_name`, `child_account_account_id`, `child_admin_api_ikey`, `child_admin_api_skey`, and `child_admin_api_host` variables to empty values. It's important to clear the variables to ensure reqeust are run on the correct account.
    

#### üîç Variable Reference

Below is a list of variables defined within this collection. Some variables are dynamically generated during API interactions, while others need to be manually configured.

| Variable Name | Description | Scope |
| --- | --- | --- |
| child_admin_api_ikey | Your Accounts API Integration Key. This needs to be manually set in the global variables. | Global |
| child_admin_api_skey | Your Accounts API Secret Key. This needs to be manually set in the global variables. | Global |
| child_admin_api_host | Your Accounts API Hostname. This needs to be manually set in the global variables. | Global |

exec: // Checks for an existing entry in child_admin_api_matrix
// Update collection variables with the details from the existing entry
console.log(`Admin API [Child] already exists on ${childAccountName} and is available for use.`);
// Return false if no existing entry was found
// If found, updates collection variables with the associated request credentials
var IKEY = pm.globals.get("accounts_api_ikey"); //Auth or Admin API IKEY
var SKEY = pm.globals.get("accounts_api_skey"); //Auth or Admin API SKEY
var API_HOSTNAME = pm.globals.get("accounts_api_host"); //Auth or Admin API Hostname
var AUTH_TYPE = 'HMAC-SHA1'; // Define the authentication type
// Check if the API hostname is defined. If not, throw an error.
throw new Error("API_HOSTNAME is not defined");
//Adds a ? at the end of the URL even if there aren't any parameters, makes it easier to find the end of the api_call
// Get the index of the start of the query parameters in the URL
// Calculate the length of the hostname
// Extract the API endpoint from the requestUrl, by removing the hostname and the query parameters
var api_call = requestUrl.slice(hostname_length, paramsStart);  //remove hostname and params to get the api_call
// Clean up api_call by removing any unwanted characters
//Create unsorted array of parameters from either URL or Body
//Assuming POST parameters are in the Body, GET paramters are in URL
//(technically it looks like POST can be in the URL as well)
// Depending on the HTTP method and the existence of a request body,
// extract the query parameters from the URL or the body into params_array
if (params_array[0] !== ""){ //check if there are any Params to encode and create the string from
var encoded_params_array = params_array.map(urlEncodeParams);  //create URL-encoded array of key=value pairs from the sorted array
encoded_params = encoded_params_array.join("&");  //create string of parameters joined by &
// Get the current timestamp in the RFC 2822 format and store it in a collection variable for later use
var timestamp = moment().format("ddd, DD MMM YYYY HH:mm:ss ZZ");
// Construct the canonical string that is to be signed, by concatenating several request elements with newlines
// Compute the HMAC-SHA1 signature of the canonical string, using SKEY as the HMAC key
//Use HTTP Basic Authentication for the request, using your integration key as the username and the HMAC-SHA1 signature as the password.
var hostname_length = apiHostname.length + 8; // Length of 'https://' is 8
var timestamp = moment().format("ddd, DD MMM YYYY HH:mm:ss ZZ");

var requestData = timestamp + "
" + httpMethod + "
" + apiHostname + "
" + api_call + "
" + encoded_params + "
" + CryptoJS.SHA512(jsonDataString) + "
" + CryptoJS.SHA512("");
// Logic to set child_account_account_id and child_auth_api_host
// Extract relevant data from responseJson and set collection variables
// Check if childAccountName is not null and not empty
// Case when childAccountName is provided but no matching account is found
console.log(`No matching account found for ${childAccountName}. Please update the child_account_name collection variable with a correct account name.`);
// Case when childAccountName is null or empty
console.log("No account name found. Please update the child_account_name collection variable with the desired account name.");
console.log("Account ID is not set. Stopping execution.");
// Pre-check for existing integration in child_admin_api_matrix
var existingEntry = currentMatrix.find(entry => entry.accountName === childAccountName && entry.accountId === accountId);
console.log(`Duo Admin API [Child] already exists for ${childAccountName} and is available for use.`);
// Optionally, you can call retrieveSecretKey or any other function here if needed.
// Update matrix and proceed to retrieve the secret key
console.error(`Request 2 failed. HTTP status code: ${res.code}; Response:`, responseData);
// Retrieve childAccountName within this function to ensure it's defined
console.log("Account ID is not provided. Stopping execution.");
console.log("Child Account Name is not provided. Stopping execution.");
console.error('Network error on the second request:', err);

console.log(`Admin API [Child] created successfully on Account ${childAccountName}. Please note: To use this application to perform API calls on the account, you are required to enable all desired permissions from the Duo Admin Panel`);
console.error(`Second request failed. Response code: ${res.code}; Response:`, responseData);
function updateMatrix(accountId, childAccountName, integrationKey, secretKey, apiHostname) {
// Make sure getAccounts function is defined somewhere above this snippet
// Clear the values of the collection variables
// Log a message to confirm the action, specifically formatted as requested
pm.test("Response time is less than 800ms", function (){

query.description: Optional: Specify a user name (or username alias) to look up a single user.

Optional: The maximum number of records returned.

Default: 100; Max: 300

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0
Required: The name of the user to create.

Optional: Username aliases for the user. Up to eight aliases may be specified with this parameter as a set of URL-encoded key-value pairs e.g. alias1=joe.smith&alias2=jsmith@example.com. Ignores alias position values not specified. Aliases must be unique amongst users. Mutually exclusive with alias1...4.
Optional: The real name (or full name) of this user.
Optional: The email address of this user.

Optional: he user‚Äôs status. One of:

‚Äúactive‚Äù - The user must complete secondary authentication. This is the default value if no status is specified.

‚Äúbypass‚Äù - The user will bypass secondary authentication after completing primary authentication.

‚Äúdisabled‚Äù - The user will not be able to complete secondary authentication.
Optional: An optional description or notes field. Can be viewed in the Duo Admin Panel.

Optional: Username aliases for the user. Up to eight aliases may be specified with this parameter as a set of URL-encoded key-value pairs e.g. alias1=joe.smith&alias2=jsmith@example.com. Ignores alias position values not specified. Remove the value for an existing alias by specifying a blank value e.g. alias1=. Aliases must be unique amongst users. Mutually exclusive with alias1...4.
Optional: The new real name (or full name).
Optional: The new status. Must be one of ‚Äúactive‚Äù, ‚Äúdisabled‚Äù, or ‚Äúbypass‚Äù. See Retrieve Users for an explanation of these fields.
Optional: The user's new given name.
Required: The user name (or username alias) of the user to enroll.
Required: The email address of this user.
Optional: The number of seconds the enrollment code should be valid for. Default: 2592000 (30 days).
Optional: Number of new bypass codes to create. At most 10 codes (the default) can be created at a time. Codes will be generated randomly.
Optional: CSV string of codes to use. Mutually exclusive with count.
Optional: The number of times generated bypass codes can be used. If 0, the codes will have an infinite reuse_count. Default: 1.
Optional: The number of seconds generated bypass codes should be valid for. If 0 (the default) the codes will never expire.

query.description: Required: The user to update via directory sync. This should be the same as the user's username in the source directory.

Default: 100; Max: 500

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.
When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.
Default: 0
Required: The name of the group.
Optional: The description of the group.

Optional: The authentication status of the group. May be one of:

‚Äúactive‚Äù - The users in the group must complete secondary authentication.

‚Äúbypass‚Äù - The users in the group will bypass secondary authentication after completing primary authentication.

‚Äúdisabled‚Äù - The users in the group will not be able to authenticate.
Optional: Update the name of the group.
Optional: Update the description of the group.

Optional: The authentication status of the group. May be one of:

‚Äúactive‚Äù - The users in the group must complete secondary authentication.

‚Äúbypass‚Äù - The users in the group will bypass secondary authentication after completing primary authentication.

‚Äúdisabled‚Äù - The users in the group will not be able to authenticate.

Optional: The maximum number of records returned.
Default: 100; Max: 500

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.
When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.
Default: 0
Required: The ID of the phone to associate with the user.
Optional: Specify a phone number to look up a single phone.

Optional: The maximum number of records returned.

Default: 100; Max: 500

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0
Optional: The phone number. A phone with a smartphone platform but no number is a tablet.
Optional: Free-form label for the phone.
Optional: The type of phone. One of: ‚Äúunknown‚Äù, ‚Äúmobile‚Äù, or ‚Äúlandline‚Äù.

Optional: The phone platform. One of: ‚Äúunknown‚Äù, ‚Äúgoogle android‚Äù, ‚Äúapple ios‚Äù, ‚Äúwindows phone 7‚Äù, ‚Äúrim blackberry‚Äù, ‚Äújava j2me‚Äù, ‚Äúpalm webos‚Äù, ‚Äúsymbian os‚Äù, ‚Äúwindows mobile‚Äù, or ‚Äúgeneric smartphone‚Äù.

‚Äúwindows phone‚Äù is accepted as a synonym for ‚Äúwindows phone 7‚Äù. This includes devices running Windows Phone 8.

If a smartphone‚Äôs exact platform is unknown but it will have Duo Mobile installed, use ‚Äúgeneric smartphone‚Äù and generate an activation code. When the phone is activated its platform will be automatically detected.
Optional: The time (in seconds) to wait after the number picks up and before dialing the extension.
Optional: The time (in seconds) to wait after the extension is dialed and before the speaking the prompt.
Optional: Free-form label for the phone.
Optional: The type of phone. One of: ‚Äúunknown‚Äù, ‚Äúmobile‚Äù, or ‚Äúlandline‚Äù.

Optional: The phone platform. One of: ‚Äúunknown‚Äù, ‚Äúgoogle android‚Äù, ‚Äúapple ios‚Äù, ‚Äúwindows phone 7‚Äù, ‚Äúrim blackberry‚Äù, ‚Äújava j2me‚Äù, ‚Äúpalm webos‚Äù, ‚Äúsymbian os‚Äù, ‚Äúwindows mobile‚Äù, or ‚Äúgeneric smartphone‚Äù.
‚Äúwindows phone‚Äù is accepted as a synonym for ‚Äúwindows phone 7‚Äù. This includes devices running Windows Phone 8.
If a smartphone‚Äôs exact platform is unknown but it will have Duo Mobile installed, use ‚Äúgeneric smartphone‚Äù and generate an activation code. When the phone is activated its platform will be automatically detected.
Optional: The time (in seconds) to wait after the number picks up and before dialing the extension.
Optional: The time (in seconds) to wait after the extension is dialed and before the speaking the prompt.
Optional: The number of seconds this activation code should be valid for. Default: 86400 (one day).
Optional: ‚Äú1‚Äù to also return an installation URL for Duo Mobile; ‚Äú0‚Äù to not return. Default: ‚Äú0‚Äù.
Optional: The number of seconds this activation code should be valid for. Default: 86400 (one day).
Optional: ‚Äú1‚Äù to cause an installation SMS message to be sent before the activation message, ‚Äú0‚Äù to not send an installation SMS message. Default: ‚Äú0‚Äù.
Optional: A custom installation message to send to the user. Only valid if installation was requested. Must contain the phrase ‚Äú<insturl>‚Äù, which is replaced with the installation URL.
Optional: A custom activation message to send to the user. Must contain ‚Äú<acturl>‚Äù, which is replaced with the activation URL.
Optional: A custom installation message to send to the user. Must contain the phrase ‚Äú<insturl>‚Äù, which is replaced with the installation URL.

item.name: Retrieve Hardware Tokens by User ID

query.description:
Optional: The maximum number of records returned.

Default: 100; Max: 500

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0
Required: The ID of the hardware token to associate with the user.

Optional: Specify a type and serial number to look up a single hardware token. One of:

‚Äúh6‚Äù - HOTP-6 hardware token
‚Äúh8‚Äù - HOTP-8 hardware token
‚Äúyk‚Äù - YubiKey AES hardware token
‚Äúd1‚Äù - Duo-D100 hardware token
f
* This option is required if serial is present.

Optional: The serial number of the hardware token.

* This option is required if type is present.

Optional: The maximum number of records returned.

Default: 100; Max: 500

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0

Required: The type of hardware token to import. One of:

‚Äúh6‚Äù - HOTP-6 hardware token
‚Äúh8‚Äù - HOTP-8 hardware token
‚Äúyk‚Äù - YubiKey AES hardware token

Duo-D100 tokens (type "d1") are imported when purchased from Duo and may not be created via the Admin API.
Required: The serial number of the token (maximum length 128 characters).
Optional: The HOTP secret. This parameter is required for HOTP-6 and HOTP-8 hardware tokens.
Optional: Initial value for the HOTP counter. Default: 0. This parameter is only valid for HOTP-6 and HOTP-8 hardware tokens.
Optional: The YubiKey private ID. This parameter is required for YubiKey hardware tokens.
Optional: The YubiKey AES key. This parameter is required for YubiKey hardware tokens.
Required: The first code from the token.
Required: The second code from the token.
Required: The third code from the token.

item.name: Email Activation Link to Administrator Pending Activation
Delete Activation Link to Administrator Pending Activation
Create Activation Link for Administrator Pending Activation
Retrieve Admin External Password Management Status
Retrieve Admin External Password Management Status by ID
Modify Admin External Password Management Status or Password

query.description:
Optional: The maximum number of records returned.

Default: 100; Max: 500

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0
Required: Return records that have a 13 character Unix timestamp in milliseconds of mintime or later. This value must be strictly less then maxtime.
Required: Return records that have a 13 character Unix timestamp in milliseconds of maxtime or earlier. This value must be strictly greater then mintime.

Optional: The type of security event.

auth	Return security events that are denied anomalous authentications.

bypass_status_enabled	Return security events that are bypass status enabled.

Optional: Automated calls will appear to come from this number. This does not apply to text messages. Customizing this number may cause telephony providers to flag your number as fraudulent and result in failed user authentications.

Optional: The email address to be notified when a user reports a fraudulent authentication attempt or is locked out due to failed authentication attempts, or empty for all administrators will be notified. If fraud_email is set to a specific email address and fraud_email_enabled is set to false, the specific email address value is cleared.

Optional: Set to true to enable fraudulent authentication notification emails. False disables the fraud email functionality. If fraud_email is set to a specific email address and fraud_email_enabled is set to false, the specific email address value is cleared.
Optional: Users will be automatically deleted if they are inactive (no successful logins) for a this amount of days. Minimum: 30 days. Maximum: 365 days.
Optional: The key for users to press to authenticate, or empty if any key should be pressed to authenticate. If this is empty, keypress_fraud must be as well.
Optional: The key for users to report fraud, or empty if any key should be pressed to authenticate. If this is empty, keypress_confirm must be as well.
Optional: Sets the language used in the browser-based user authentication prompt. One of: ‚ÄúEN‚Äù, ‚ÄúDE‚Äù, ‚ÄúFR‚Äù. Default: ‚ÄúEN‚Äù

Optional: If non-zero, the time in minutes until a locked-out user‚Äôs status reverts to ‚ÄúActive‚Äù. If 0, a user remains locked out until their status is manually changed (By an admin or API call). Minimum: 5 minutes. Maximum: 30000 minutes.
Optional: The number of consecutive failed authentication attempts before the user‚Äôs status is set to ‚ÄúLocked Out‚Äù and the user is denied access.

Optional: The minimum number of characters that an administrator‚Äôs Duo Admin Panel password must contain. This is only enforced on password creation and reset; existing passwords will not be invalidated. 

Default: 12.

Optional: Legacy parameter; no effect if specified. Use Duo policies to configure this setting.

If true, users will be able to use authenticate with a passcode generated by Duo Mobile. If false, users will not be able to authenticate with a passcode generated by Duo Mobile. Note that if false, this will override Duo Mobile passcodes for any groups.

Optional: If true, administrator passwords will be required to contain a lower case alphabetic character. If false, administrator passwords will not be required to contain a lower case alphabetic character. This is only enforced on password creation and reset; existing passwords will not be invalidated. Default: false.

Optional: If true, administrator passwords will be required to contain a numeric character. If false, administrator passwords will not be required to contain a numeric character. This is only enforced on password creation and reset; existing passwords will not be invalidated. Default: false.

Optional: If true, administrator passwords will be required to contain a special (non-alphanumeric) character. If false, administrator passwords will not be required to contain a special (non-alphanumeric) character. This is only enforced on password creation and reset; existing passwords will not be invalidated. Default: false.

Optional: If true, administrator passwords will be required to contain an upper case alphabetic character. If false, administrator passwords will not be required to contain an upper case alphabetic character. This is only enforced on password creation and reset; existing passwords will not be invalidated. Default: false.

Optional: Legacy parameter; no effect if specified. Use Duo policies to configure this setting.

If true, users will be able to use Duo Push to authenticate. If false, users will not be able to use Duo Push to authenticate. Note that if false, this will override push_enabled for any groups.
Optional: How many passcodes to send at one time, up to 10.

Optional: Legacy parameter; no effect if specified. Use Duo policies to configure this setting.

If true, users will be able to use SMS passcodes to authenticate. If false, users will not be able to use SMS passcodes to authenticate. Note that if false, this will override sms_enabled for any groups.
Optional: The time in minutes to expire and invalidate SMS passcodes, or empty if they should not expire.
Optional: Description sent with every batch of SMS passcodes.
Optional: If 1, a new set of SMS passcodes will automatically be sent after the last one is used. If 0, a new set will not be sent.
Optional: Configure a alert to be sent when the account has fewer than this many telephony credits remaining.

Optional: This is the timezone used when displaying timestamps in the Duo Admin Panel. Timezones must be entries in the IANA Time Zone Database, for example, ‚ÄúUS/Eastern‚Äù, ‚ÄúAustralia/Darwin‚Äù, ‚ÄúGMT‚Äù.

Optional: Legacy parameter; no effect if specified. Use Duo policies to configure this setting.

If true, users will be able to authenticate using voice callback. If false, users will not be able to authenticate using voice callback. Note that if false, this will override voice_enabled for any groups.
Optional: The maximum number of telephony credits a user may consume in a single authentication event. This excludes Duo administrators authenticating to the Duo administration panel. Default: 20.

Optional: Legacy parameter; no effect if specified. Use Duo policies to configure this setting.

If true, users will be able to use authenticate with a U2F device. If false, users will not be able to authenticate with a U2F device. Default: false.
Optional: Specify a user name (or username alias) to look up a single user.

Optional: The maximum number of records returned.

Default: 100; Max: 300

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0
Optional: Specify a user name (or username alias) to look up a single user.

Optional: The maximum number of records returned.

Default: 100; Max: 300

Optional: The offset from 0 at which to start record retrieval.

When used with "limit", the handler will return "limit" records starting at the n-th record, where n is the offset.

Default: 0
Optional: Limit report to events before this UNIX timestamp. Defaults to the current time.
Optional: Limit report to events after this UNIX timestamp. Defaults to thirty days before maxtime.
Optional: Limit report to events before this UNIX timestamp. Defaults to the current time.
Optional: Limit report to events after this UNIX timestamp. Defaults to thirty days before maxtime.

exec: // Require 'url' module to use its methods for handling and transforming URLs.
// Get the hostname for the accounts API from Postman collection variables.
// Declare a variable to hold Duo Authentication Version
function getAuthHeader(httpMethod, hostname, path, q_str, requestBody, duo_auth_ver) {
var IKEY = pm.collectionVariables.get("child_admin_api_ikey"); //Auth or Admin API IKEY
var SKEY = pm.collectionVariables.get("child_admin_api_skey"); //Auth or Admin API SKEY
var API_HOSTNAME = pm.collectionVariables.get("child_admin_api_host"); //Auth or Admin API Hostname
// The current time, formatted as RFC 2822. This must be the same string as the "Date" header (or X-Duo-Date header).
var timestamp = moment().format("ddd, DD MMM YYYY HH:mm:ss ZZ");
// Create unsorted array of parameters from either URL or Body
// Assuming POST parameters are in the Body, GET parameters are in URL
params_array.sort(); // Lexicographically sort parameters by key
